instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay adds an upward impulse of 1000 units to launch the actor into the air.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Launcher
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=1000)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Launcher
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: MakeVector [X=0, Y=0, Z=1000]
NODE n4: AddImpulse
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n4.Impulse [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Impulse [Vector]
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Launcher
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: MakeVector [X=0, Y=0, Z=1000]
NODE n4: AddImpulse
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n4.Impulse [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Impulse [Vector]

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick adds a constant forward force of 500 units to the actor.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ConstantPush
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorForwardVector
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=500.0]
NODE n4: AddForce
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Force [Vector]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ConstantThrust
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorForwardVector
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=500]
NODE n4: AddForce
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Force [Vector] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ConstantThrust
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorForwardVector
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=500]
NODE n4: AddForce
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Force [Vector] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that pressing Interact toggles physics simulation on and off using SetSimulatePhysics.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_PhysicsToggle
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n4: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleSimulation
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Target=Self, Simulate=true]
NODE n4: SetSimulatePhysics [Target=Self, Simulate=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleSimulation
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Target=Self, Simulate=true]
NODE n4: SetSimulatePhysics [Target=Self, Simulate=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick moves the actor forward by 2 units per frame using AddActorLocalOffset.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SlowMover
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: AddActorLocalOffset [DeltaLocation=(X=2.0,Y=0,Z=0)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MovingForward
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetVar [Variable=Speed]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=2.0]
NODE n4: MakeVector [Y=0.0, Z=0.0]
NODE n5: AddActorLocalOffset
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.DeltaLocation [Vector]
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MovingForward
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetVar [Variable=Speed]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=2.0]
NODE n4: MakeVector [Y=0.0, Z=0.0]
NODE n5: AddActorLocalOffset
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.DeltaLocation [Vector]

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap teleports the overlapping actor to location (0, 0, 500) using SetActorLocation.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Teleporter
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: MakeVector [X=0, Y=0, Z=500]
NODE n3: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n3.Target [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.NewLocation [Vector]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TeleportOnOverlap
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: GetWorldLocation
NODE n3: MakeVector [X=0, Y=0, Z=500]
NODE n4: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n4.NewLocation [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.NewLocation [Vector]>
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TeleportOnOverlap
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: GetWorldLocation
NODE n3: MakeVector [X=0, Y=0, Z=500]
NODE n4: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n4.NewLocation [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.NewLocation [Vector]>

instruction: Create a Blueprint that when overlapped, enables physics on itself and adds an upward impulse of 2000.

PARENT: Actor

NODE n2: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n3: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=2000)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_OverlapImpulse

CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: SetSimulatePhysics [Target=Self, Simulate=true]
NODE n3: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=2000)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute>

NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: SetSimulatePhysics [Target=Self, Simulate=true]
NODE n3: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=2000)]

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a vector variable TargetLocation. On Tick, lerp the actor's position toward TargetLocation at alpha 0.05.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SmoothMover
PARENT: Actor
VAR TargetLocation: Vector
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=TargetLocation]
NODE n4: Lerp [Alpha=0.05]
NODE n5: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Vector]
DATA n3.Value -> n4.B [Vector]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.NewLocation [Vector]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_LerpingActor
PARENT: Actor
VAR TargetLocation: Vector = (0, 0, 0)
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetVar [Variable=TargetLocation]
NODE n3: Lerp [Alpha=0.05]
NODE n4: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.Alpha [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.NewLocation [Vector]);
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_LerpingActor
PARENT: Actor
VAR TargetLocation: Vector = (0, 0, 0)
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetVar [Variable=TargetLocation]
NODE n3: Lerp [Alpha=0.05]
NODE n4: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.Alpha [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.NewLocation [Vector]);

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick reads the MoveForward input axis value and moves the actor forward by that amount using AddActorLocalOffset.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_InputMover
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetInputAxisValue [AxisName="MoveForward"]
NODE n3: MakeVector [Y=0, Z=0]
NODE n4: AddActorLocalOffset
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.X [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.DeltaLocation [Vector]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MovingPlatform
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
VAR CurrentSpeed: Float = 0.0
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetInputAxisValue [AxisName="MoveForward"]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=100.0]
NODE n4: ClampFloat [Min=-500.0, Max=500.0]
NODE n5: MakeVector [Y=0.0, Z=0.0]
NODE n6: AddActorLocalOffset
EXEC n1.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Value [Float]
DATA n4.Value -> n5.X [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.DeltaLocation [Vector] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MovingPlatform
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
VAR CurrentSpeed: Float = 0.0
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetInputAxisValue [AxisName="MoveForward"]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=100.0]
NODE n4: ClampFloat [Min=-500.0, Max=500.0]
NODE n5: MakeVector [Y=0.0, Z=0.0]
NODE n6: AddActorLocalOffset
EXEC n1.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Value [Float]
DATA n4.Value -> n5.X [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.DeltaLocation [Vector] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Hit adds an impulse in the opposite direction of the hit normal multiplied by 500.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Bouncer
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Hit
NODE n2: MultiplyFloat [B=-500.0]
NODE n3: AddImpulse
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.HitNormal -> n2.A [Vector]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Impulse [Vector]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ReflectImpulse
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_CustomEvent [EventName="Hit"]
NODE n2: GetWorldDeltaSeconds
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=500.0]
NODE n4: AddImpulse
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.HitNormal -> n3.A [Vector]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.B [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Impulse [Vector] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ReflectImpulse
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_CustomEvent [EventName="Hit"]
NODE n2: GetWorldDeltaSeconds
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=500.0]
NODE n4: AddImpulse
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.HitNormal -> n3.A [Vector]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.B [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Impulse [Vector] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with two vector variables PointA and PointB and a boolean AtA starting true. On Tick, if AtA is true move toward PointA, otherwise move toward PointB. When distance to target is less than 50, flip AtA.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Patrol
PARENT: Actor
VAR PointA: Vector
VAR PointB: Vector
VAR AtA: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=AtA]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=PointA]
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=PointB]
NODE n6: GetActorLocation
NODE n7: Lerp [Alpha=0.02]
NODE n8: Lerp [Alpha=0.02]
NODE n9: SetActorLocation
NODE n10: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n9.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n10.Execute
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.A [Vector]
DATA n4.Value -> n7.B [Vector]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n9.NewLocation [Vector]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n8.A [Vector]
DATA n5.Value -> n8.B [Vector]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n10.NewLocation [Vector]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Pingpong
PARENT: Actor
VAR PointA: Vector = (0, 100, 0)
VAR PointB: Vector = (0, -100, 0)
VAR AtA: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetVar [Variable=PointA]
NODE n3: GetVar [Variable=PointB]
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: GetVar [Variable=AtA]
NODE n6: MoveTo
NODE n7: MoveTo
NODE n8: DistanceBetween
NODE n9: LessThan [B=50]
NODE n10: FlipFlop
NODE n11: SetVar [Variable=AtA]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n5.Value -> n4.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n4.True -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n6.Destination [Vector]
EXEC n4.False -> n7.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n7.Destination [Vector]
EXEC n6.Completed -> n8.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n8.A [Vector]
DATA n6.ActualDestination -> n8.B [Vector]
EXEC n7.Completed -> n8.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n8.A [Vector]
DATA n7.ActualDestination -> n8.B [Vector]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.A [Float]
EXEC n9.ReturnValue -> n10.Execute
EXEC n10.Execute -> n11.Execute
DATA n10.ReturnValue -> n11.Value [Bool]
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Pingpong
PARENT: Actor
VAR PointA: Vector = (0, 100, 0)
VAR PointB: Vector = (0, -100, 0)
VAR AtA: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetVar [Variable=PointA]
NODE n3: GetVar [Variable=PointB]
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: GetVar [Variable=AtA]
NODE n6: MoveTo
NODE n7: MoveTo
NODE n8: DistanceBetween
NODE n9: LessThan [B=50]
NODE n10: FlipFlop
NODE n11: SetVar [Variable=AtA]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n5.Value -> n4.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n4.True -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n6.Destination [Vector]
EXEC n4.False -> n7.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n7.Destination [Vector]
EXEC n6.Completed -> n8.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n8.A [Vector]
DATA n6.ActualDestination -> n8.B [Vector]
EXEC n7.Completed -> n8.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n8.A [Vector]
DATA n7.ActualDestination -> n8.B [Vector]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.A [Float]
EXEC n9.ReturnValue -> n10.Execute
EXEC n10.Execute -> n11.Execute
DATA n10.ReturnValue -> n11.Value [Bool]

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay waits 3 seconds, then enables physics simulation and prints Physics Enabled.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedPhysics
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Physics Enabled"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedPhysics
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Target=Self, Simulate=true]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Physics Enabled"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedPhysics
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Target=Self, Simulate=true]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Physics Enabled"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick rotates 1 degree on Yaw and moves forward 1 unit. This makes the actor move in a circle.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CircleMover
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: AddActorLocalRotation [DeltaRotation=(Pitch=0,Yaw=1.0,Roll=0)]
NODE n3: AddActorLocalOffset [DeltaLocation=(X=1.0,Y=0,Z=0)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CircleMover
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Movement
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorForwardVector
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=0.01]
NODE n4: AddActorLocalOffset
NODE n5: MakeRotator [Yaw=1]
NODE n6: AddActorLocalRotation
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n1.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.DeltaLocation [Vector]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.DeltaRotation [Rotator] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CircleMover
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Movement
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorForwardVector
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=0.01]
NODE n4: AddActorLocalOffset
NODE n5: MakeRotator [Yaw=1]
NODE n6: AddActorLocalRotation
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n1.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.DeltaLocation [Vector]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.DeltaRotation [Rotator] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a boolean IsHeavy. On overlap, if IsHeavy add force of 5000 upward, else add force of 1000 upward.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ConditionalForce
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsHeavy: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsHeavy]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=5000)]
NODE n5: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=1000)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FloatingObject
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsHeavy: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_OverlapActor
NODE n2: Branch
NODE n3: AddForce [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=500)]
NODE n4: AddForce [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=100)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.True -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.False -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n3.Target [Actor]
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n4.Target [Actor] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FloatingObject
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsHeavy: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_OverlapActor
NODE n2: Branch
NODE n3: AddForce [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=500)]
NODE n4: AddForce [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=100)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.True -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.False -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n3.Target [Actor]
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n4.Target [Actor] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap adds a downward force of 3000 to the overlapping actor every tick while they remain overlapped. On end overlap, stop.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GravityZone
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsOverlapping: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: VariableSet [VarName=IsOverlapping]
NODE n3: Event_ActorEndOverlap
NODE n4: VariableSet [VarName=IsOverlapping]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA true -> n2.Value [Bool]
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA false -> n4.Value [Bool]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ContinuousForce
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
VAR ForceMagnitude: Float = 3000.0
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: Branch
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent
NODE n4: GetVar [Variable=ForceMagnitude]
NODE n5: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=-1), Scale=1.0]
NODE n6: Event_ActorEndOverlap
NODE n7: RemoveFromParent
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.True -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.Scale [Float]
EXEC n1.Otherwise -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ContinuousForce
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
VAR ForceMagnitude: Float = 3000.0
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: Branch
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent
NODE n4: GetVar [Variable=ForceMagnitude]
NODE n5: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=-1), Scale=1.0]
NODE n6: Event_ActorEndOverlap
NODE n7: RemoveFromParent
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.True -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.Scale [Float]
EXEC n1.Otherwise -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick gets the actor location. If the Z position is below 0, set it to 0 using SetActorLocation. Print Clamped when this happens.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FloorClamp
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: BreakVector
NODE n4: LessThan [B=0.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: MakeVector [Z=0.0]
NODE n7: SetActorLocation
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Clamped"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Input [Vector]
DATA n3.Z -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n7.Execute
DATA n3.X -> n6.X [Float]
DATA n3.Y -> n6.Y [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.NewLocation [Vector]
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ClampZ
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: LessEqualFloat [B=0.0]
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: SetActorLocation

GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: MultiGate
NODE n3: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=500,Z=0)]
NODE n4: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=-500,Z=0)]
NODE n5: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=500)]

EXEC n2.Out_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_2 -> n5.Execute

NODE n7: DestroyActor

EXEC n6.Completed -> n7.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a float variable Speed at 100. On Tick, multiply Speed by DeltaSeconds, move actor forward by that amount. On pressing SpeedUp, add 50 to Speed.

VAR Speed: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Speed]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat

NODE n6: Event_InputAction [ActionName="SpeedUp"]
NODE n7: VariableGet [VarName=Speed]
NODE n8: AddFloat [B=50.0]

DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.DeltaLocation [Vector]
EXEC n6.Pressed -> n9.Execute
DATA n7.Value -> n8.A [Float]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.Value [Float]
